title: Ticket #3554: Lark - belt and suspenders for cleaning up interfaces
description:
If a condor_starter with the Lark plugin encounters a "kill -9" at an inopportune time, it may leak the Lark networking devices to the system. This leaves cruft and may leave the slot in a non-functional state until the admin intervenes.

We should do two improvements:

  • On condor_startd initialization, clean out any Lark-owned devices.
  • When we call PrepareNetwork, if the veth already exists, clean it out before proceeding.
remarks:

Second bullet-point fixed now. Delaying startd changes for a bit.
